basics.name: Caleb Atwood
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: While my professional projects to date have primarily consisted of scaled backend services, database design, and web frontends for Xbox Live, my personal projects walk the spectrum... mobile react apps, ecommerce sites, computer vision algorithms, 3D reconstruction applications, game development, drone construction, home-security hardware design, simulation, several musical projects, and a startup to boot.

work.summary: Service platform engineer on Xbox Live, the collection of services that comprise Xbox's social graph, content distribution, and multiplayer. On multiple occasions, I worked across org with other teams to bring Xbox Live configuration to their products.
highlights: Primary dev on Xbox Developer Portal solving for catalog, ingestion, and frontend features.
Designed, built, and subsequently filed a patent for a Xbox Devkit Conversion system. See Patents.
Lead an initiative to integrate the Xbox publishing backend with the Windows Dev Center frontend to enable large game binary encryption workflows in the Windows Dev Center
Delivered a content and catalog management system for enabling user generated content, currently used in Minecraft's custom content store.
Lead a small team in designing Game Modes, a real-time configuration service for describing custom gameplay options for multiplayer titles, currently visible in the shell during tournament creation.

work.summary: Mixing the Microsoft Kinect, cutting edge 3D computer vision algorithms, and a completely fresh 3D in-browser experience, myFit's goal was to change the way you shop for clothing. My role entailed system architecture design, task lead, back-end and front-end developing, 2D and 3D computer vision, and product design.
highlights: Won the Plug and Play Tech Accelerator in Sunnyvale, CA.
Project lead of a team of 3 engineers

awards.title: Converting a Retail Gaming Device Into A Development Kit Remotely
awards.summary: Console development hardware is specialized hardware that is provided to developers. This solution facilitates the activation of development capabilities remotely in order to allow any retail device to be used for development.

awards.title: Method and System for Creating a Virtual Avatar for Fitting Clothing
awards.summary: Inventor on a new method for uploading and processing 3 dimensional point cloud scans of the human body to simulate clothing physics on the reconstructed mesh.

publications.name: Festival
publications.summary: A React-Native + Redux IOS application built with Firebase for sharing geo-localized conversation and content at music festivals.

publications.name: Minecraft Go
publications.summary: An augmented reality mobile app based on Pokemon Go, with real terrain and procedurally generated structures that resemble those from the game Minecraft. Built with Unity, Google Places, and MapZen.
